sentence.text: From the pass which stands at 6700ft , the Tujetschtal valley drops 3000ft through Alpine meadows to Disentis town , ten miles to the east .
The ground dropped sharply beneath us as we bounced off the nearest trunk .
Some are in a state of imminent collapse and in others , side passages branch off in all directions and shafts can suddenly appear at your feet dropping down hundreds of feet into the darkness .
A dirt track drops from the Tizi n'Test to Souk Sebt , but this is now being extended too produce can flow in and out : an extraordinary effort .
Sharpe urged his horse down the rutted lane that dropped into a shallow valley before climbing between two unhedged pastures .
The land appeared to drop towards the sea on one side of the triangle and to lift to a wooded escarpment on the other .
` But suddenly the sea bottom just dropped away and it was waist deep .
The road was open , and dropped down to cross a valley .
When the accompanying stream drops over a ledge , it is a signal to retreat and return to daylight .
He pulled away the towel from her head , let the loose flow of golden hair drop over her shoulders .
She swayed , her lashes dropping over her enormous lagoon-blue eyes .
Then the ground was gone , dropping away in a series of gentle jerks .
To her left the land dropped away to the river below , sheer and terrifying .
On my left the ground drops away through uncertain undergrowth into back gardens and a view of rooftops .
The land obviously dropped steeply away into a small valley , woodland rising up on the other side towards the slopes of the Downs .
Our path dropped down to the relative calm of the sea shore , edging craggy inlets beneath overhanging cliff tops .
It climbs steeply through trees , into quiet hillside streets from which little lanes and stairways drop suddenly down into the blue distances of the city .
